body:
You can remove it from the config and it should be just fine. 
Or just force the config to be re-saved and it should also go away too.

What is the effect on functionality here, apart from just being OCD?
I want to make triply sure my directory is a directory, so I use a trailing slash, just like with other linux tools.
I personally prefer not to have the extra character
Well that's okay, personal preference. But adding the character ensures a behaviour, so it's strange that the character is hidden.

I don't think the extra character ensures anything.

Index wise, directories are stored without the slash at the end, which then makes pattern matching easier, as go's built in file iterator returns paths without slashes at the end, etc.

So we are already unsafe just by using the standard library.

We do slash "harmonization" of the config at startup.

https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/master/internal/config/config.go#L270

You can enter `~/yep/////` if you like (and this is fine in Unix); we'll normalize to `~/yep`. As Audrius notes, there is no behavioral aspect of `yep` vs `yep/`, and we need to clean it up to some standard because Windows pathnames are not like the other children...

For me this does have a behavioral aspect as my folder path is a symlink.
So I have a symlink `/my/path` -> `/the/real/folder`
This means that `/my/path/` works fine right after adding it but after restarting syncthing it gets "harmonized" to `/my/path` which is not a directory and it stops syncing.

I tried to enable `followSymlinks` as described in http://docs.syncthing.net/draft/followsymlinks.html but this does not seem to affect the top folder path.

I think it would be useful to allow trailing slashes at least with the `followSymlinks` option enabled.
Given it's a root symlink, why can't you just point it at the right path?
We could also ensure that the slash harmonification ensures an ending slash. That ought to be fine for all platforms.
That solves it for me! Would love to see it in the next release. Thanks for helping and keep up the good work.
Main thing is tests need fixing. Probably sufficient to just `filepath.FromSlash("foo/")` everywhere we would test for just "foo".

Something like this?
https://github.com/eipiminus1/syncthing/commit/fe97b4f8c36180fc96a62bb5ccaa956c6d6b5140

`./build.sh test` looks good to me.

If
followSymlinks-true-followSymlinks (how do you escape markdown)
 is set in the config.xml  it will be removed if the config of that folder is saved at a later point using the gui including Message asking for restart. Which is how I noticed. I did press save to exit but I didn't change anything so there wasn't a reason to restart.
Sorry, what does this have to do with this issue? If it says it needs a restart, it means something has changed. Follow symlinks does not exist in the official releases
